definition: to visit relatives
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
relative/parent/grief/sorrow/battle-axe
surname Qi

sentences.english: I do not like to visit relative for I feel boring.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜好走親戚我以爲那太煩了。

sentences.english: Whenever we go back to the place my wife was born, we always have to make the rounds of her relatives.
sentences.chinese: 每次去我妻子的老家，我們都得一家一家地走親戚。

sentences.english: After celebrating at home, my parents used to take me to visit some of our relatives.
sentences.chinese: 在家裏過完年以後，我父母會帶我去走親戚。

sentences.english: Previously, during the holidays, two relatives to buy two chicken.
sentences.chinese: 以前，在過節時，二人走親戚買兩隻燒雞。

definition: to boast
electric bell
pinkeye/envy/jealousy
see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: leave of absence request (from work or school)
(not) a single person/(no) one
to whisper to one another's ear
foolish talk/nonsense
to postpone one's graduation (e.g. by undertaking additional studies) (abbr. for 延後畢業|延后毕业[yan2 hou4 bi4 ye4])
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
variant of 慪氣|怄气[ou4 qi4]
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
